metadata.Title: CVE-2019-5953 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Buffer overflow in GNU Wget 1.20.1 and earlier allows remote attackers to cause a denial-of-service (DoS) or may execute an arbitrary code via unspecified vectors.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-5953` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

wget - 1.15-1ubuntu1.14.04.5
No subscription required

notes.Note: mdeslaur> actually fixed in 1.20.3, not in 1.20.2

criterions.comment: wget package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.15-1ubuntu1.14.04.5').
